1.text: 1. State whether the following statements are TRUE or FALSE. a. Sinbad had a large fortune. - b. The ship sailed to several harbours. - c. They landed on an island. - d. The creature was big. - e. Sinbad swam to an island. -
1.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>1. State whether the following statements are TRUE or FALSE. a. Sinbad had a large fortune. - b. The ship sailed to several harbours. - c. They landed on an island. - d. The creature was big. - e. Sinbad swam to an island. -</prosody></speak>

2.text: 2. Answer the questions. a. Where did Sinbad sail? b. Why did he go sailing? c. What happened to the ship? d. Where did Sinbad and his crew land? e. Write a description of Sinbad.
2.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>2. Answer the questions. a. Where did Sinbad sail? b. Why did he go sailing? c. What happened to the ship? d. Where did Sinbad and his crew land? e. Write a description of Sinbad.</prosody></speak>

3.text: 3. Write an ending to the story.
3.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>3. Write an ending to the story.</prosody></speak>

6.text: Form groups and narrate a similar folk story from Sri Lanka or from another country to the class.
6.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Form groups and narrate a similar folk story from Sri Lanka or from another country to the class.</prosody></speak>

9.text: a litter of puppies a herd of cows a bunch of flowers a flock of pigeons a bunch of ripe bananas
9.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>a litter of puppies a herd of cows a bunch of flowers a flock of pigeons a bunch of ripe bananas</prosody></speak>

10.text: The words in bold are called collective nouns. We use collective nouns to bring a group of people or objects together.
10.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>The words in bold are called collective nouns. We use collective nouns to bring a group of people or objects together.</prosody></speak>
